 29 -class Timer(Component): 

 30      """ 
 31      Base class for simulated hardware timers. 
 32   
 33      @ivar callback: Function to be called when timer fires. 
 34      """ 
 35   
 36      __metaclass__ = ABCMeta 
 37   

 38 -    def __init__(self, platform): 

 39          self._process = None 
 40          Component.__init__(self, platform) 

 41   

 42 -    class _TimerProcess(SimPy.Simulation.Process): 

 43 -        def __init__(self, timer): 

 44              self.timer = timer 
 45              SimPy.Simulation.Process.__init__(self, 
 46                      sim=self.timer.platform.simulation.engine) 
 47              self._lastTime = self.sim.now() 
 48              self.sim.activate(self, self.eventLoop()) 

 49   

 50 -        def eventLoop(self): 

 51              while True: 
 52                  yield SimPy.Simulation.hold, self, self.timer._period 
 53                  if self.timer._process is self: 
 54                      if self.timer.callback is not None: 
 55                          self.timer.callback() 
 56                      if not self.timer._repeat: 
 57                          self.timer._process = None 
 58                          return 
 59                  else: 
 60                      return 

 61   

 62 -        def timeElapsed(self): 

 63              return self.sim.now() - self._lastTime 

 64   

 65 -    def _simulationChange(self): 

 66          self._process = None 

 67   

 68 -    def start(self, period, repeat=False): 

 69          """ 
 70          Start the timer. 
 71   
 72          @param period: Duration after which the timer should fire. 
 73          @param repeat: If True, repeat at the given period, else fire once. 
 74          """ 
 75          self._period = self._truePeriod(period) 
 76          self._repeat = repeat 
 77          self._process = self._TimerProcess(self) 

 78   

 79 -    def clear(self): 

 80          """ 
 81          Clear the timer. 
 82          """ 
 83          self._process = None 

 84   

 85 -    def timeElapsed(self): 

 86          """ 
 87          Get the measured time elapsed since this timer was started. 
 88          """ 
 89          return self._measuredPeriod(self._process.timeElapsed())

 92 -    def _truePeriod(self, targetPeriod): 

 93          """ 
 94          Convert an requested period to an actual elapsed period of the timer. 
 95          """ 
 96          pass 

 97

 99 -    def _measuredPeriod(self, _truePeriod): 

100          """ 
101          Convert an actual elapsed period to a period reported by the timer. 
102          """ 
103          pass

105 -class IdealTimer(Timer): 

106      """ 
107      An ideal timer with infinite resolution and no clock error. 
108      """ 
109   

110 -    def _truePeriod(self, targetPeriod):

116 -class ParametricTimer(Timer): 

117      """ 
118      An timer with parametric resolution and frequency error. 
119   
120      All period durations will be quantised by rounding up to the next multiple 
121      of the nominal period. 
122   
123      The clock is modelled as having a fixed frequency offset which is randomly 
124      selected at initialisation time based on the freqError parameter. 
125      """ 
126   
127      @prepend_method_doc(Component) 

128 -    def __init__(self, platform, frequency, freqError, rng=None): 

129          """ 
130          @param frequency: Clock frequency in Hz. 
131          @param freqError: Maximum frequency error in parts per million (ppm). 
132              The frequency error is assumed to be normally distributed with 
133              freqError corresponding to 3 standard deviations. 
134          @param rng: L{np.random.RandomState} from which to draw frequency 
135              error. 
136          """ 
137          Timer.__init__(self, platform) 
138   
139          if rng is None: 
140              rng = np.random.RandomState() 
141   
142          self._idealFreq = frequency 
143          freqSigma = (freqError * 1E-6) / 3 
144          freqError = rng.normal(loc=1, scale=freqSigma) 
145          self._actualFreq = self._idealFreq * freqError 

146   

147 -    def _truePeriod(self, targetPeriod): 

148          return np.ceil(targetPeriod * self._idealFreq) / self._actualFreq 

149   

150 -    def _measuredPeriod(self, _truePeriod): 

151          return np.floor(_truePeriod * self._actualFreq) / self._idealFreq
